question: The quorum to constitute a sitting of the Lok Sabha is __?
option1: One tenth of the total members
option2: One tenth of the members present
option3: One fifth of the total members
option4: One fifth of the members present
answer: One tenth of the total members
explanation: Quoram The quorum to constitute a sitting of the House is one-tenth of the total number of members of the House, for both Lok Sabha as well as Rajya Sabha. If there is no quorum, it shall be the duty of the chairman or speaker to adjourn the house or suspend the meeting.
